original: 10 Indriyayamaka🔽10.3 Pariññāvāra🔽10.3.3. Anāgatavāra
analyzed: indriya yamaka  pariññāvāra  anāgatavāra
translated: The Twin Verses on Faculties🔽The Chapter on Full Understanding

original: 10.3.3.1. Anuloma
analyzed: anuloma
translated: … the future🔽… regular sequence

original: Yo cakkhundriyaṁ parijānissati so domanassindriyaṁ pajahissatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānissati saḥ domanassa indriyam pajahissati iti
translated: Will anyone who fully understands the eye faculty abandon the grief faculty?

original: Dve puggalā cakkhundriyaṁ parijānissanti, no ca domanassindriyaṁ pajahissanti. Pañca puggalā cakkhundriyañca parijānissanti domanassindriyañca pajahissanti.🔽Yo vā pana domanassindriyaṁ pajahissati so cakkhundriyaṁ parijānissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: dve puggalā cakkhu indriyam parijānissanti no ca domanassa indriyam pajahissanti pañca puggalā cakkhu indriyam ca parijānissanti domanassa indriyam ca pajahissanti  yaḥ vā pana domanassa indriyam pajahissati saḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānissati iti āmantā
translated: Two persons will fully understand the eye faculty but will not abandon the grief faculty. Five persons will both fully understand the eye faculty and abandon the grief faculty.🔽Or will anyone who abandons the grief faculty fully understand the eye faculty?

original: Yo cakkhundriyaṁ parijānissati so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvessatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānissati saḥ anaññātaññassāmīti indriyam bhāvessati iti
translated: Will anyone who fully understands the eye faculty develop the I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown faculty?

original: Cha puggalā cakkhundriyaṁ parijānissanti, no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvessanti.
analyzed: cha puggalā cakkhu indriyam parijānissanti no ca anaññātaññassāmīti indriyam bhāvessanti
translated: Six persons will fully understand the eye faculty but will not develop the I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown faculty.

original: Ye puthujjanā maggaṁ paṭilabhissanti te cakkhundriyañca parijānissanti anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca bhāvessanti.
analyzed: ye puthujjanāḥ maggam paṭilabhissanti te cakkhu indriyam ca parijānissanti anaññātaññassāmi itindriyam ca bhāvessanti
translated: Those ordinary persons who will obtain the path will both fully understand the eye faculty and develop the I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown faculty.

original: Yo vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvessati so cakkhundriyaṁ parijānissatīti? Āmantā.🔽Yo cakkhundriyaṁ parijānissati so aññindriyaṁ bhāvessatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam bhāvessati saḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānissati iti āmantā  yaḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānissati saḥ aññindriyam bhāvessati iti āmantā
translated: Or will anyone who develops the final-knowledge faculty fully understand the eye faculty?🔽Will anyone who fully understands the eye faculty develop the final-knowledge faculty?

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ bhāvessati so cakkhundriyaṁ parijānissatīti? Āmantā.🔽Yo cakkhundriyaṁ parijānissati so aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam bhāvessati saḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānissati iti āmantā  yaḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānissati saḥ aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissati iti āmantā
translated: Or will anyone who develops the final-knowledge faculty fully understand the eye faculty?🔽Will anyone who fully understands the eye faculty realize the final-knowledge faculty?

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissati so cakkhundriyaṁ parijānissatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissati saḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānissati iti
translated: Or will anyone who realizes the final-knowledge faculty fully understand the eye faculty?

original: Aggamaggasamaṅgī aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissati, no ca cakkhundriyaṁ parijānissati.
analyzed: aggamagga samaṅgī aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissati no ca cakkhu indriyam parijānissati
translated: One possessing the path of arahantship will realize the final-knowledge faculty but will not fully understand the eye faculty.

original: Satta puggalā aññātāvindriyañca sacchikarissanti cakkhundriyañca parijānissanti.
analyzed: satta puggalā aññātāvindriyañca sacchikarissanti cakkhu indriyañca parijānissanti
translated: Seven persons will both realize the final-knowledge faculty and fully understand the eye faculty.

original: (Cakkhundriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: cakkhu indriya mūlaka
translated: (The section on the eye faculty.)

original: Yo domanassindriyaṁ pajahissati so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvessatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ domanassa indriyam pajahissati saḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam bhāvessati iti
translated: Will anyone who abandons the grief faculty develop the final-knowledge faculty?

original: Cattāro puggalā domanassindriyaṁ pajahissanti, no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvessanti.
analyzed: cattāro puggalāḥ domanassindriyam pajahissanti no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyam bhāvessanti
translated: Four persons will abandon the sorrow faculty, but will not develop the I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown faculty.

original: Ye puthujjanā maggaṁ paṭilabhissanti te domanassindriyañca pajahissanti anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca bhāvessanti.
analyzed: ye puthujjanāḥ maggam paṭilabhissanti te domanassindriyam ca pajahissanti anaññātaññassāmītindriyam ca bhāvessanti
translated: Those ordinary people who will obtain the path will abandon both the sorrow faculty and will develop the I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown faculty.

original: Yo vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvessati so domanassindriyaṁ pajahissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana anaññātaññassāmi itindriyam bhāvessati saḥ domanassindriyam pajahissati iti āmantā
translated: Or, is it that whoever will develop the I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown faculty will abandon the sorrow faculty?

original: Yo domanassindriyaṁ pajahissati so aññindriyaṁ bhāvessatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ domanassindriyam pajahissati saḥ aññindriyam bhāvessati iti āmantā
translated: Whoever will abandon the sorrow faculty will develop the I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown faculty?

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ bhāvessati so domanassindriyaṁ pajahissatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam bhāvessati saḥ domanassindriyam pajahissati iti
translated: Or, is it that whoever will develop the I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown faculty will abandon the sorrow faculty?

original: Dve puggalā aññindriyaṁ bhāvessanti no ca domanassindriyaṁ pajahissanti, pañca puggalā aññindriyañca bhavissanti domanassindriyañca pajahissanti.
analyzed: dve puggalāḥ aññindriyam bhāvessanti no ca domanassindriyam pajahissanti pañca puggalāḥ aññindriyam ca bhavissanti domanassindriyam ca pajahissanti
translated: Two persons will develop the I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown faculty but will not abandon the sorrow faculty; five persons will both develop the I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown faculty and abandon the sorrow faculty.

original: Yo domanassindriyaṁ pajahissati so aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ domanassa indriyam pajahissati saḥ aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissati iti āmantā
translated: Whoever will abandon the sorrow faculty will realize the I-have-known faculty?

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissati so domanassindriyaṁ pajahissatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissati saḥ domanassindriyam pajahissati iti
translated: Or is it that whoever will realize the unbinding of the mind will abandon the distress faculty?

original: Tayo puggalā aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissanti, no ca domanassindriyaṁ pajahissanti.
analyzed: tayo puggalā aññātau indriyam sacchikarissanti no ca domanassa indriyam pajahissanti
translated: Three kinds of persons will realize the unbinding of the mind, but will not abandon the distress faculty.

original: Pañca puggalā aññātāvindriyañca sacchikarissanti domanassindriyañca pajahissanti.
analyzed: pañca puggalā aññātāvindriyañca sacchikarissanti domanassindriyañca pajahissanti
translated: Five kinds of persons will both realize the unbinding of the mind and abandon the distress faculty.

original: (Domanassindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: domanassindriya mūlaka
translated: (Based on the distress faculty.)

original: Yo anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvessati so aññindriyaṁ bhāvessatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam bhāvessati saḥ aññindriyam bhāvessati iti āmantā
translated: “Is it the case that whoever will develop the faculty of ‘I am coming to the end of suffering’ will develop the faculty of ‘I am one who knows the right time’?

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ bhāvessati so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvessatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam bhāvessati saḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam bhāvessati iti
translated: Or is it that whoever will develop the faculty of ‘I am one who knows the right time’ will develop the faculty of ‘I am coming to the end of suffering’?

original: Cha puggalā aññindriyaṁ bhāvessanti, no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvessanti.
analyzed: cha puggalāḥ aññindriyam bhāvessanti no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyam bhāvessanti
translated: Six kinds of persons will develop the faculty of ‘I am one who knows the right time,’ but will not develop the faculty of ‘I am coming to the end of suffering.’

original: Ye puthujjanā maggaṁ paṭilabhissanti te aññindriyañca bhāvessanti anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca bhāvessanti.
analyzed: ye puthujjanāḥ maggam paṭilabhissanti te aññ indriyam ca bhāvessanti anaññātaññassāmītindriyam ca bhāvessanti
translated: Those who are ordinary persons, who have not attained the path, will both develop the faculty of ‘I am one who knows the right time’ and develop the faculty of ‘I am coming to the end of suffering.’

original: Yo anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvessati so aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam bhāvessati saḥ aññātau indriyam sacchikarissati iti āmantā
translated: “Is it the case that whoever will develop the faculty of ‘I am coming to the end of suffering’ will realize the unbinding of the mind?

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissati so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvessatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātau indriyam sacchikarissati saḥ anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam bhāvessati iti
translated: Or does anyone who will realize the final-knowledge-of-a-learner-faculty develop the final-knowledge-of-a-learner-faculty?

original: Satta puggalā aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissanti, no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvessanti.🔽Ye puthujjanā maggaṁ paṭilabhissanti te aññātāvindriyañca sacchikarissanti anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca
analyzed: satta puggalāḥ aññātau indriyam sacchikarissanti no ca bhāvessanti  ye puthujjanāḥ maggam paṭilabhissanti te aññātau indriyam ca sacchikarissanti
translated: Seven persons will realize the final-knowledge-of-a-learner-faculty, but they will not develop the final-knowledge-of-a-learner-faculty.

original: bhāvessanti. (Anaññātaññassāmītindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yo aññindriyaṁ bhāvessati so aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: bhāvessanti  yaḥ aññindriyam bhāvessati saḥ aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissati iti āmantā
translated: Those who are ordinary men and will obtain the path will realize the final-knowledge-of-a-learner-faculty and they will develop the final-knowledge-of-a-learner-faculty. (The section based on the final-knowledge-of-a-learner-faculty.)

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissati so aññindriyaṁ bhāvessatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissati saḥ aññindriyam bhāvessati iti
translated: Does anyone who will develop the final-knowledge-of-a-learner-faculty realize the final-knowledge-of-a-learner-faculty?

original: Aggamaggasamaṅgī aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarissati, no ca aññindriyaṁ bhāvessati. Satta puggalā aññātāvindriyañca sacchikarissanti aññindriyañca bhāvessanti. (Aññindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: aggamagga samaṅgī aññātāvindriyam sacchikarissati no ca aññindriyam bhāvessati satta puggalā aññātāvindriyam ca sacchikarissanti aññindriyam ca bhāvessanti aññindriya mūlaka
translated: One who is possessed of the path of the highest fruit will realize the final-knowledge-of-a-learner-faculty, but he will not develop the final-knowledge-of-a-learner-faculty. Seven persons will realize the final-knowledge-of-a-learner-faculty and they will develop the final-knowledge-of-a-learner-faculty. (The section based on the final-knowledge-of-a-learner-faculty.)

original: 10.3.3.2. Paccanīka
analyzed: paccanīka
translated: ... the reverse order

original: Yo cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānissati so domanassindriyaṁ nappajahissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānissati saḥ domanassindriyam na ppajahissati iti āmantā
translated: “Will anyone who does not fully understand the eye faculty abandon the faculty of grief?” They may or may not.

original: Yo vā pana domanassindriyaṁ nappajahissati so cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānissatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana domanassa indriyam na pajahissati so cakkhu indriyam na parijānissati iti
translated: “Will anyone who does not abandon the faculty of grief not fully understand the eye faculty?”

original: Dve puggalā domanassindriyaṁ nappajahissanti, no ca cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānissanti. Tayo puggalā domanassindriyañca nappajahissanti cakkhundriyañca na parijānissanti.🔽Yo cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānissati so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: dve puggalā domanassindriyam na pajahissanti no ca cakkhundriyam na parijānissanti tayo puggalā domanassindriyam ca na pajahissanti cakkhundriyam ca na parijānissanti  yaḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānissati saḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvessati iti āmantā
translated: Two kinds of persons will not abandon the faculty of grief but will fully understand the eye faculty. Three kinds of persons will neither abandon the faculty of grief nor fully understand the eye faculty.🔽“Will anyone who does not fully understand the eye faculty develop the faculty of final knowledge?” They may or may not.

original: Yo vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessati so cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānissatīti.🔽Cha puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessanti, no ca cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānissanti.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvessati so cakkhu indriyam na parijānissati iti  cha puggalāḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvessanti no ca cakkhundriyam na parijānissanti
translated: “Will anyone who does not develop the faculty of final knowledge not fully understand the eye faculty?”🔽Six kinds of persons will not develop the faculty of final knowledge but will fully understand the eye faculty.

original: Tayo puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvessanti cakkhundriyañca na parijānissanti.
analyzed: tayo puggalāḥ cakkhu indriyañca na parijānissanti
translated: Three kinds of persons will neither develop the faculty of final knowledge nor fully understand the eye faculty.

original: Yo cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānissati so aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānissati saḥ aññindriyam na bhāvessati iti āmantā
translated: “He who does not fully understand the eye faculty will not develop the other faculties”? Unrestricted.

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessati so cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam na bhāvessati saḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānissati iti āmantā
translated: “He who does not develop the other faculties will not fully understand the eye faculty”? Unrestricted.

original: Yo cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānissati so aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānissati saḥ aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati iti
translated: “He who does not fully understand the eye faculty will not realize the final knowledge of arahatship”?

original: Aggamaggasamaṅgī cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānissati, no ca aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissati. Dve puggalā cakkhundriyañca na parijānissanti aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarissanti.
analyzed: aggamagga samaṅgī cakkhu indriyam na parijānissati no ca aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati dve puggalā cakkhu indriyam ca na parijānissanti aññātāvindriyam ca na sacchikarissanti
translated: One possessing the path of arahantship does not fully understand the eye faculty, but he does realize the final knowledge of arahatship. Two kinds of persons do not fully understand the eye faculty and do not realize the final knowledge of arahatship.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissati so cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānissatīti? Āmantā. (Cakkhundriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yo domanassindriyaṁ nappajahissati so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati saḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānissati iti āmantā cakkhu indriya mūlaka  yaḥ domanassa indriyam na ppajahissati saḥ anaññātaññassāmīti indriyam na bhāvessati iti āmantā
translated: “He who does not realize the final knowledge of arahatship will not fully understand the eye faculty”? Unrestricted. (Eye Faculty)🔽“He who will not abandon the sorrow faculty will not develop the final-knowledge-of-arahatship faculty”? Unrestricted.

original: Yo vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessati so domanassindriyaṁ nappajahissatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvessati so domanassindriyam na ppajahissati iti
translated: “He who will not develop the final-knowledge-of-arahatship faculty will not abandon the sorrow faculty”?

original: Cattāro puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessanti, no ca domanassindriyaṁ
analyzed: cattāro puggalāḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvessanti no ca domanassindriya
translated: Four persons do not develop the “I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown” faculty, but they do not abandon the grief faculty.

original: nappajahissanti. Pañca puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvessanti domanassindriyañca nappajahissanti.
analyzed: na ppajahissanti pañca puggalāḥ anaññātaññassāmi itindriyañca na bhāvessanti domanassindriyañca na ppajahissanti
translated: Five persons do not develop the “I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown” faculty and do not abandon the grief faculty.

original: Yo domanassindriyaṁ nappajahissati so aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ domanassindriyam na pajahissati saḥ aññindriyam na bhāvessati iti
translated: “Will anyone who does not abandon the grief faculty not develop the final-knower faculty?

original: Dve puggalā domanassindriyaṁ nappajahissanti, no ca aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessanti. Tayo puggalā domanassindriyañca nappajahissanti aññindriyañca na bhāvessanti.🔽Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessati so domanassindriyaṁ nappajahissatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: dve puggalā domanassindriyam na ppajahissanti no ca aññindriyam na bhāvessanti tayo puggalā domanassindriyam ca na ppajahissanti aññindriyam ca na bhāvessanti  yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam na bhāvessati saḥ domanassindriyam na ppajahissati iti āmantā
translated: Two persons do not abandon the grief faculty but they do develop the final-knower faculty. Three persons do not abandon the grief faculty and do not develop the final-knower faculty.🔽“Or will anyone who does not develop the final-knower faculty not abandon the grief faculty?

original: Yo domanassindriyaṁ nappajahissati so aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ domanassa indriyam na ppajahissati saḥ aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati iti
translated: “Will anyone who does not abandon the grief faculty not realize the final-knower faculty?

original: Tayo puggalā domanassindriyaṁ nappajahissanti, no ca aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissanti. Dve puggalā domanassindriyañca nappajahissanti aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarissanti.
analyzed: tayo puggalā domanassindriyam na ppajahissanti no ca aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissanti dve puggalā domanassindriyam ca na ppajahissanti aññātāvindriyam ca na sacchikarissanti
translated: Three kinds of persons will not abandon the sorrow faculty, but will not realize the final knowledge. Two kinds of persons will not abandon the sorrow faculty and will not realize the final knowledge.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissati so domanassindriyaṁ nappajahissatīti? Āmantā. (Domanassindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati saḥ domanassindriyam na ppajahissati iti āmantā domanassindriya mūlaka
translated: Or, if anyone will not realize the final knowledge, will he not abandon the sorrow faculty? Yes. (The sorrow faculty is to be per-muted with the final knowledge.)

original: Yo anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessati so aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvessati saḥ aññindriyam na bhāvessati iti
translated: If anyone will not develop the “I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown” faculty, will he not develop the final-knowledge faculty?

original: Cha puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessanti, no ca aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessanti. Tayo puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvessanti aññindriyañca na bhāvessanti.
analyzed: cha puggalāḥ anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam na bhāvessanti no ca aññindriyam na bhāvessanti tayo puggalāḥ anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam ca na bhāvessanti aññindriyam ca na bhāvessanti
translated: Six kinds of persons will not develop the “I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown” faculty, but will develop the final-knowledge faculty. Three kinds of persons will not develop the “I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown” faculty and will not develop the final-knowledge faculty.

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessati so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam na bhāvessati saḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvessati iti āmantā
translated: Or, if anyone will not develop the final-knowledge faculty, will he not develop the “I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown” faculty? Yes.

original: Yo anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessati so aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissatīti?🔽Satta puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessanti, no ca aññātāvindriyaṁ na
analyzed: yaḥ anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam na bhāvessati saḥ aññātau indriyam na sacchikarissati iti  satta puggalāḥ anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam na bhāvessanti no ca aññātāvindriyam na
translated: “He who does not develop the faculty of final knowledge will not realize the faculty of final knowledge?”

original: sacchikarissanti. Dve puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvessanti aññātāvindriyañca🔽na sacchikarissanti.🔽Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissati so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvessatīti? Āmantā. (Anaññātaññassāmītindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: sacchikarissanti dve puggalā anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyañca na bhāvessanti aññātāvindriyañca  na sacchikarissanti  yaḥ vā pana aññātau indriyam na sacchikarissati saḥ anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam na bhāvessati iti āmantā anaññātaññassāmi iti indriya mūlaka
translated: Seven persons do not develop the faculty of final knowledge, but they do realize the faculty of final knowledge. Two persons neither develop the faculty of final knowledge nor realize the faculty of final knowledge.🔽“He who does not realize the faculty of final knowledge will not develop the faculty of final knowledge?”🔽“He who does not develop the faculty of final knowledge will not realize the faculty of final knowledge?”

original: Yo aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessati so aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissatīti?🔽Aggamaggasamaṅgī aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessati, no ca aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissati. Dve puggalā aññindriyañca na bhāvessanti aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarissanti.
analyzed: yaḥ aññindriyam na bhāvessati saḥ aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati iti 🔽aggamagga samaṅgī aññindriyam na bhāvessati no ca aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati dve puggalā aññindriyam ca na bhāvessanti aññātāvindriyam ca na sacchikarissanti
translated: “He who does not develop the faculty of final knowledge will not realize the faculty of final knowledge?”🔽“He who does not develop the faculty of final knowledge will not realize the faculty of final knowledge?”🔽“He who does not develop the faculty of final knowledge will not realize the faculty of final knowledge?”🔽“He who does not develop the faculty of final knowledge will not realize the faculty of final knowledge?”

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarissati so aññindriyaṁ na bhāvessatīti? Āmantā. (Aññindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarissati saḥ aññindriyam na bhāvessati iti āmantā aññindriya mūlaka
translated: Or, he who will not realize the final-knower faculty, will he not develop the final-knower faculty? Reply: Yes.
